Package game

Class Avatar

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
city.cs.engine.Walker
game.Avatar
public class Avatar
extends city.cs.engine.Walker
Creates and contains all fields for the playable character

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean alive  
    private int ammoCount  
    private static city.cs.engine.BodyImage avatarImage  
    private static city.cs.engine.Shape avatarShape  
    private boolean cooldown  
    private java.lang.String direction  
    private int lifeCount  
    private org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 spawnpoint  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Avatar​(city.cs.engine.World world)
    Places Main avatar in world param and adds the image to it

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void decreaseLife()
    Decreases the life count of the main character, used when a collision is detected between the player and an npc enemy to injure the player If the life count reaches 0 the main character is destroyed as the player has lost Sets a damage cooldown of 0.5 seconds so the player has the ability to remove the character from the damage causing situation to prevent further damage
    boolean getAlive()
    Retrieves the alive state of the main character
    int getAmmoCount()
    Retrieves the ammo count of the main character, used when moving the character to the next level or saving the game state
    boolean getCooldown()
    Retrieves if the main character is currently on cooldown, used in the collision listener Damage
    java.lang.String getDirection()
    Retrieves the direction the main character is facing, used to make the character shoot in the direction that they are facing
    int getLifeCount()
    Retrieves how many lives the character has got, used to display the number of lives on screen for the user, save the correct life count when the game is saved.
    void incrementLife()
    Increments the current character's life count
    void setAlive​(boolean alive)
    Sets the alive state of the main character to the given parameter
    void setAmmoCount​(int ammoCount)
    Sets the ammo count of the current player to that of the given parameter
    void setAvatarImage​(city.cs.engine.BodyImage avatarImage)
    Sets the image of the character to the parameter image.
    void setCooldown​(boolean cooldown)
    Sets the cooldown of the main character to being the given parameter
    void setDirection​(java.lang.String direction)
    sets the character's direction to the given parameter, used to make the character have the direction they are moving in
    void setLifeCount​(int lifeCount)
    Assigns the characters life count to the given count, used when resetting the level, moving to the next level to preserve life count on the last level and used when restoring the main character from a save file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Avatar

      public Avatar​(city.cs.engine.World world)
      Places Main avatar in world param and adds the image to it
      Parameters:
      world - current world

  • Method Details

    • setAvatarImage

      public void setAvatarImage​(city.cs.engine.BodyImage avatarImage)
      Sets the image of the character to the parameter image. Used so the character faces the direction they are moving in
      Parameters:
      avatarImage - given image to set to the character

    • incrementLife

      public void incrementLife()
      Increments the current character's life count

    • getLifeCount

      public int getLifeCount()
      Retrieves how many lives the character has got, used to display the number of lives on screen for the user, save the correct life count when the game is saved.
      Returns:
      lifeCount the current number of lives the character has

    • setLifeCount

      public void setLifeCount​(int lifeCount)
      Assigns the characters life count to the given count, used when resetting the level, moving to the next level to preserve life count on the last level and used when restoring the main character from a save file.
      Parameters:
      lifeCount - life count being assigned

    • decreaseLife

      public void decreaseLife()
      Decreases the life count of the main character, used when a collision is detected between the player and an npc enemy to injure the player If the life count reaches 0 the main character is destroyed as the player has lost Sets a damage cooldown of 0.5 seconds so the player has the ability to remove the character from the damage causing situation to prevent further damage

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection​(java.lang.String direction)
      sets the character's direction to the given parameter, used to make the character have the direction they are moving in
      Parameters:
      direction - character's direction they are facing

    • getDirection

      public java.lang.String getDirection()
      Retrieves the direction the main character is facing, used to make the character shoot in the direction that they are facing
      Returns:
      direction the direction the main character is facing

    • getCooldown

      public boolean getCooldown()
      Retrieves if the main character is currently on cooldown, used in the collision listener Damage
      Returns:
      the cooldown state of the main character

    • setCooldown

      public void setCooldown​(boolean cooldown)
      Sets the cooldown of the main character to being the given parameter
      Parameters:
      cooldown -

    • setAlive

      public void setAlive​(boolean alive)
      Sets the alive state of the main character to the given parameter
      Parameters:
      alive - new alive state of the main character

    • getAlive

      public boolean getAlive()
      Retrieves the alive state of the main character
      Returns:
      alive state of the character

    • getAmmoCount

      public int getAmmoCount()
      Retrieves the ammo count of the main character, used when moving the character to the next level or saving the game state
      Returns:
      ammoCount the current ammo count of the character

    • setAmmoCount

      public void setAmmoCount​(int ammoCount)
      Sets the ammo count of the current player to that of the given parameter
      Parameters:
      ammoCount - new ammo count of the main character
